intro: Pedicularis macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to red, often resembling those of orchids. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and meadows. Its leaves are alternate and often covered in fine hairs, while its stem is erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
